thread.title: Family friendly: Get to the Greek for family fun
thread.title_full: Family friendly: Get to the Greek for family fun - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Family friendly: Get to the Greek for family fun
text:

( James Nielsen / Chronicle )
Photo: James Nielsen, Staff Richard Jacky left, Andrew Lambaakis center, and Stephano... Family friendly: Get to the Greek for family fun 1 / 5 Back to Gallery Mad Hatter Tea Party
The Woodlands Children's Museum will bring "Alice in Wonderland" to life with its annual Mad Hatter Tea Party. Children will be able to decorate their own cookies at this casual tea party, as well as engage in Alice-inspired games and art projects geared for ages 7 and younger.
When: 10 a.m.-2 p.m. Friday
Where: 4775 W. Panther Creek, The Woodlands
Tickets: $5; woodlandschildrensmuseum.org
Original Greek Festival
More than 40,000 folks are expected to attend this four-day Montrose festival that kicks off Thursday at the Annunciation Greek Orthodox Cathedral complex. As always, there will be traditional Greek dancing and music, educational presentations and fun shopping opportunities. Beer, wine and Greek food, including gyros and pastries, will be available for purchase.
When: 5-10 p.m. Thursday; 11 a.m.-3 p.m. and 5-10 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Saturday; and noon-6 p.m. Sunday.
Where: 3511 Yoakum
Tickets: $5, free for ages 12 and younger; originalgreekfestival.com
Zombie Quest
Weekends in October are all about a fun, but not-so-scary time at the Putt-Putt FunHouse . The family center's Zombie Quest enlists youngsters in the Elite Anti-Zombie Response Team. Team members then hunt throughout the FunHouse for zombie body parts. After all the zombie parts are found, kids can trade them for a prize from the Zombie Supply Crate. Children dressed as zombies will receive a $5 playcard.
When: 4-10 p.m. Fridays, 10 a.m.-10 p.m. Saturdays and 1-8 p.m. Sundays, through Oct. 31
Where: 806 E. NASA Parkway, Webster
Tickets: $5 or free with the purchase of an all-day pass; puttputtfunhouse.com
Park to Port Bike Ride
The second annual Park to Port Ride covers a 20-mile route starting and ending at Hermann Park. The route, which travels east along Brays Bayou, turns around at Brady's Landing at the Port of Houston. A post-ride party complete with food, drinks and music will be held at the Bill Coats Bridge in Hermann Park. The bridge is located off of Almeda near Dixie. Register online or in person 7-9 a.m. Saturday. Proceeds benefit Hermann Park Conservancy.
When: 7 a.m.-12:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: 6001 Fannin
Registration: $35; hermannpark.org
